properties.name: addressCountry
properties.description: The country. For example, USA. You can also provide the two-letter ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 country code.

properties.name: addressLocality
properties.description: The locality. For example, Mountain View.

properties.name: postOfficeBoxNumber
properties.description: The post office box number for PO box addresses.

properties.name: streetAddress
properties.description: The street address. For example, 1600 Amphitheatre Pkwy.

ContactPoint.name: areaServed
ContactPoint.description: The location served by this contact point (e.g., a phone number intended for Europeans vs. North Americans or only within the United States).

ContactPoint.name: availableLanguage
ContactPoint.description: A language someone may use with the item.

ContactPoint.name: contactOption
ContactPoint.description: An option available on this contact point (e.g. a toll-free number or support for hearing-impaired callers).

ContactPoint.name: contactType
ContactPoint.description: A person or organization can have different contact points, for different purposes. For example, a sales contact point, a PR contact point and so on. This property is used to specify the kind of contact point.

ContactPoint.name: hoursAvailable
ContactPoint.description: The hours during which this contact point is available.

ContactPoint.name: productSupported
ContactPoint.description: The product or service this support contact point is related to (such as product support for a particular product line). This can be a specific product or product line (e.g. "iPhone") or a general category of products or services (e.g. "smartphones").

Thing.name: additionalType
Thing.description: An additional type for the item, typically used for adding more specific types from external vocabularies in microdata syntax. This is a relationship between something and a class that the thing is in. In RDFa syntax, it is better to use the native RDFa syntax - the 'typeof' attribute - for multiple types. Schema.org tools may have only weaker understanding of extra types, in particular those defined externally.

Thing.name: description
Thing.description: A short description of the item.

Thing.name: image
Thing.description: An image of the item. This can be a URL or a fully described ImageObject.

Thing.name: potentialAction
Thing.description: Indicates a potential Action, which describes an idealized action in which this thing would play an 'object' role.

Thing.name: sameAs
Thing.description: URL of a reference Web page that unambiguously indicates the item's identity. E.g. the URL of the item's Wikipedia page, Freebase page, or official website.
